intro: Seseli taquetii, commonly known as the Taquet's seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, typical of the family. Seseli taquetii is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
